step.para: After registration you may acquire the &susemgr; media here: . Boot the server with the media. You may install SUSE Manager using many media formats: CDROM, USB, or ISO combined with your virtualization solution or even using network PXE boot. For more information see also: insert link to reference guide
Use the up and down arrow keys to select the option Install/Restore SUSE-Manager-Server and then press enter.
After the media boots you will be presented with a dialog box requesting permission to destroy all data on disk. Select Yes if you are sure, this action will destroy all data on disk.

warning.title: Data Wipe!
warning.para: After selecting Yes all data on this drive will be destroyed!

step.para: Once disk preparations have completed select your language and keyboard layout using tab to move between fields and the up and down arrow keys to select your preferences. Hit enter to finalize your selection.
Press alt + n to continue.
At the License Agreement page use tab to select Yes, I agree to the License Agreement and press enter to mark it.
Press alt + n to continue.
Enter your root password.
Press alt + n to continue.
At the network Configuration screen select change to configure your network interfaces. Select Network Interfaces when the pop-up menu appears.
Select edit to edit your network interface.
We will be using DHCP for this setup. Select Dynamic Address and press alt + n to continue.
Select Ok at the next screen to continue.
Press alt + n at the next screen to continue.

sect1.title: Clock and Time Zone

important.title: Date, Time, and NTP
important.para: Current date, time and NTP is very important for SUSE Manager. If your NTP settings are setup improperly during installation you should be aware that this will have a severe impact on the creation of your SSL certificate and will prohibit &susemgr; from syncing with &scc;. An NTP failure will also prevent &susemgr; from receiving updates as well as the required software sources/channels for your client systems. There should be an NTP server available and enabled upon boot.

step.para: Select your Region.
Select your Time Zone.
To change your date, time, or to configure your NTP settings press the alt + ccommand now.

sect1.para: If you encounter certificate errors please review the following list.

listitem.para: Check that the time settings in your servers BIOS are up-to-date.
Ensure your server's CMOS battery is not dead or in need of replacement.
Ensure you are not blocking the NTP server with your firewall.

para.remark: add a note that for VMware servers the localtime option needs to be disabled.

listitem.para: After this installation has completed and before running the yast2 susemanager_setupcommand to setup &susemgr;, use the datecommand from the command line to ensure your date and time is current.

step.para: At the Advanced NTP Configuration screen select Now and on Boot.
You may Add,Edit or Delete Synchronization configurations here.
Select Add to add an NTP server from your region or alternatively you may add a local NTP server from your network.
Select alt + o to continue.

step.para: Once you have finished the setup of NTP you may continue to the &scc; registration screen.

This section requires your &susemgr; product registration code. This should be on hand now. At the &scc; screen select the Registration Code check box with tab then press enter. Finally press alt + n to continue.

The registration browser will open. Move through the registration browser with tab and use the enter enter key to edit fields. If you get lost you may use the left and right arrow keys to go back and forwards a page at a time.
Insert the email address associated with your &scc; account.
Enter your activation code provided via email or alternatively listed under your product subscriptions page at the &scc;.
Scroll the page using tab and select Submit to proceed. Naming your system is optional.
